items.title: Presets support, more warpings mods and support for their automation
items.body:
1. Add the ability to save and use presets
2. Add more warp modes, for example from the Xfer Serum synthesizer
3. Add the ability to automate warpingknobs. In Bitwig Studio, for example, they are not displayed in the instrument panel

items.title: It is not possible to press play / pause im Ableton while using the Plugin.
items.body: Normally I can use the spacebar in Ableton to press pause and play while using a plugin. When I click on a parameter in the Wolf Shaper plugin, this no longer works while working in the plugin. I then have to press an area in Ableton again for the space bar to work again.

items.title: vst3 version of the plugin shows up as missing when transferring project from Win to Mac
items.body:
Hi! I tried to open an Ableton project I'm working on my Windows 10 PC on my Macbook, and Wolf Shaper shows up as missing (all the other plugins show up just fine). I tried it in an empty project again, also the other way around, and it also wasn't working. I'm only using default installation paths so normally it should find the plugin no problem. 
When I tried this with the vst2 version of the plugin (even manually renamed the dll on Windows to match the one on the Mac) it was working just fine and Ableton recognized it as the same plugin and loaded it without problems.

items.title: Stuck at max volume on latest version from github
items.body: Running `wolf-shaper-git` from AUR, on the latest version, in Ardour 7 on Linux, and any track that I put wolf shaper on has its volume meter maxed out, and no audio comes thru from any tracks at all. I think for some reason wolf shaper is outputting a constant +1.0 or -1.0 value, which causes all audio to get clipped to the max/minimum. I switch to the non-AUR build which I think is the latest release build, and that one works, so this must have been a fairly recent issue.

items.title: Fix dsp/gui inconsistencies and improve generic UI
items.body:
Changes should be self-explanatory, but to summarize:
- DSP and UI should start with the same state, otherwise UI will show incorrect values
- Enumerations are nice so hosts that use generic UI can show those as the real parameter values instead of just numbers
- The gain controls were set as logarithmic, but no log scale was ever in use in the GUI, removed the hint to make DSP side behave the same as the UI does

items.title: Tweak project layout
items.body:
This PR modifies the file structure of the project to make it a bit more conventional:

- Replace `plugins/wolf-shaper` directory with `/src`
- Move `plugins/wolf-shaper/Libs/` directory to `/libs`
- Move Chivo font to `/resources`
- Move Screenshot.png to the `/docs` folder
- Put shell scripts in `/tools`
- Remove the Debian package from the source tree. On Debian and derivated systems, the plugin can be installed through other means, such as the [KXStudio repositories](https://kx.studio/Repositories).

items.title: Implement right-click menu as widget instead of window
items.body:
Hi! here is my reimplementation of RightClickMenu as a widget instead of a window.

Some notes:

- I named it MenuWidget instead of RightClickMenu, since it can be used as a generic drop-down menu
- I added a clang-format file. I only used it to format MenuWidget to fit the style of the rest of the code, but thought I'd include it since it might be useful to have project-wide formatting.
- My variable names use snake_case instead of camelCase, can change that if necessary
- I had to use chivo bold as the font. It seems the default font was disabled in upstream DPF because it wouldn't display any text unless I specified a font. That meant I had to change from a ✓ to a regular dash because the font didn't seem to include that glyph. I think it still looks ok tho
- We have to call a method on the top-level UI class to close the widget if the mouse goes out of bounds. With this configuration, instead of testing whether the mouse is outside of some bounds, we could just make it close whenever something else is clicked (like a control). I've left it testing if the mouse goes out of bounds but I don't think it would be hard to change the behaviour.
- If window-manager based window resizing is implemented, then it might break the mouse bounds checking in the case where a menu is shown while the window is being resized. I think there is probably a callback/event we can use to fix that tho.

items.title: Add CMake support
items.body:
This PR allows building the plugin using CMake.

Thanks @jpcima for adding CMake support in DPF :)

items.title: Get rid of Wolf Common
items.body:
This submodule is annoying to work with. Let's keep the files directly in the wolf-shaper repo instead.

This PR also fixes a few unrelated compiler warnings.

This theme doesn't really fit the aesthetic of the plugin.

items.title: Plugin calls mutex.unlock() even if locking fails?
items.body:
This line of code: 

https://github.com/wolf-plugins/wolf-shaper/blob/b5c8c457abbe2212ce20644895be4243a2ba5740/plugins/wolf-shaper/WolfShaperPlugin.cpp#L312

is followed by:

https://github.com/wolf-plugins/wolf-shaper/blob/b5c8c457abbe2212ce20644895be4243a2ba5740/plugins/wolf-shaper/WolfShaperPlugin.cpp#L403

I assume we should call `unlock()` only when `tryLock()` returns `true`.

items.title: FreeBSD build fixes
items.body:
- Disable DGL's file browser. This plugin does not need it, and it would make the build fail because of mntent.h (which does not appear to exist on FreeBSD)
- Fix missing GL include while building Wolf Common:
```
In file included from Common/Utils/src/Mathf.cpp:1:
In file included from ../../dpf/dgl/Geometry.hpp:20:
../../dpf/dgl/Base.hpp:82:11: fatal error: 'GL/gl.h' file not found
```
- The build would fail because of this shebang: https://github.com/wolf-plugins/DPF/blob/e5fb1bc2f4f49937fb7585052d4a74b1e427327d/utils/generate-ttl.sh#L1. I changed the shebang to `/usr/bin/env bash`, which should be more portable.

items.title: Get rid of inih

items.title: Add unit tests / snapshot tests
items.body:
We should add some automated tests, to ensure that we don't break anything as we work on new features!

There are many unit testing frameworks for C++, but I don't know which one would be the best...

items.title: Switch to upstream DPF
items.body:
Get rid of this fork: https://github.com/wolf-plugins/DPF
Switch to https://github.com/DISTRHO/DPF instead, to make maintenance easier.

items.title: Tweenable Preset Values : Feature Request
items.body: If there is a way of taking a snapshot of values, the plugin could interpolate between presets, like an autofilter of some sort. For example, if a user adds to a preset of one graph, and adds a second preset of another graph. The plugin could, either through midi program change or some osc target, morph between one preset to the next. There could be a time/glide knob to set the speed of this interpolation.

items.title: Increase the range of the pre/post knobs
items.body:
The pre and post knobs are not powerful enough. Sometimes, even if I set the "pre" knob to its max value, I have to use a separate gain plugin in order to boost the input signal to a satisfying level.

This is easy to fix, but I'm pretty sure it's a breaking change...

items.title: Bipolar mode changes display : Feature request
items.body: It looks as if some other wave shapers in bipolar mode have a center point at the zero crossing mark, and converts the unipolar mode graph into the positive part of the graph, and a linear graph onto the negative part. Right now, the graph is used as-is in bipolar mode when switched from unipolar mode. Maybe the bi/uni button should also include this behaviour of having a center zeroed keypoint when switched

items.title: Add numerical units to knobs : Feature Request
items.body: The knobs do not display the level that they are at. It would be nice to see how high the numbers are for each knob.

items.title: First switch of wave type often doesn't work
items.body: This shouldn't be too difficult to reproduce. But just adding some nodes and trying to change wave types for them, often doesn't work and one needs to try the dropdown menu more than once to get the waveform to actually change.

items.title: Support for Ubuntu 19.10 (Eoan Ermine)
items.body:
I'm actually running Pop_OS (https://github.com/pop-os), a flavor of Ubuntu maintained by hardware manufacturer System76, version 19.10 (Eoan Ermine), however, the package management is exactly the same, so this will apply to Ubuntu 19.10 users as well.

I was able to install and get wolf-shaper working by pointing the install to the disco release.  So far, so good, so obviously this isn't urgent. 

Incidentally, in case anyone else sees this and is curious (and aren't experienced using Linux/Ubuntu/etc), here's some additional info to help you out:

1) I installed wolf-shaper per the instructions in the README, except:
2) Before you add the ppa repository, you have to run sudo apt update (it won't run after).  So just run 'sudo apt update' first, then use the commands in the README.
3)  I then (after install is complete & I played w/ the UI to make sure it was kosher) removed the ppa via `sudo apt-add-repository --remove ppa:<repo-address>`
4)  If you don't do #3, any package you've installed via apt, which is the main package manager you should be using to install most things into Ubuntu, ***WILL NOT UPDATE*** (so #3 is very important if you don't wanna fuck up your shit up).
-- Note: Ardour users are recommended by the core Ardour dev team to not use apt to install, so use Ardour.org's download instructions (they can't support the package on apt).

The alternative to doing this is to go into the /etc/apt/sources.list manually so it points to the disco release instead of eoan.  Suggestion: if you don't know what any of that last sentence means, just do it the way I did (it's easy).

My personal preference is to wait for a repo (of wolf-shaper) dedicated to the release (of Ubuntu) that I'm using.   If you're doing the same, you should subscribe to this post to see when it's closed (then simply add the ppa repo back, update, etc, per the instructions in the README).

If you have any bugs or issues using wolf-shaper after following my instructions (down the line, in the future), make sure you double check the version installed on your computer and ensure it's the most up-to-date version that's been released (meaning: you might have missed an update because your not getting automatic updates thru apt, until you re-add the ppa when this post is closed!)

also:

use your text editor of choice to look at your sources.list file (nano/vim/etc), eg:
`nano /etc/apt/sources.list`

check your installed apps (version number returned in results):

`apt list --installed wolf*`

labels.name: windows

So OBS has support for VST Plugins and wolfshaper has a problem where the UI does not move at all when opened in OBS Studio and here is a gif to prove it : 
![oZKviu2wBy](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37266538/59638307-51fa0480-9158-11e9-917b-122c01116be5.gif)

items.title: Bypass automatically when there is no input
items.body: Right now, the plugin takes CPU even when there is no input / output.

items.title: Packaging, contrib files and location
items.body:
I would like to move the latest stable version of this nice plugin to Arch Linux' [community] repository.
I see you already did some work on trying to ease the work for package maintainers and the like in #42. However, I have some questions and notes on it:

* it doesn't make sense to maintain your PKGBUILD within this repository. The AUR has git repositories per-package for that already and you're actually the [maintainer of the wolf-shaper-git package](https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/wolf-shaper-git/). Detailed build/installation instructions should be enough.
* the XDG desktop file and icon should not be located in `pkg/debian/`, as those files apply to all distros. a `contrib` directory would probably be more reasonable.
* the Debian packaging should be dealt with downstream as well (same reasons as with Arch Linux packaging), or are you building this package and publishing it somewhere?
* as this git repository contains some submodules, it would be great, if you could release a source code version with the submodules already checked out (as reference, have a look at [how this was achieved for supercollider's sc3-plugins](https://github.com/supercollider/sc3-plugins/blob/master/package/create_package.sh)).
* generally I'd also be happy, if you would consider [signing your git tags and/or commits](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Tools-Signing-Your-Work) and/or release tarballs (in the case you implement something similiar as what is noted above regarding the tarballs including the submodules).

items.title: Propose a 'Wolf Shaper (Lite)' binary?
items.body:
It should be possible to optimize the DSP usage of the plugin by pre-calculating the graph's function, instead of recalculating some parts of it at every frame.

However, this would make warp modes unsuitable for automation. So, perhaps it would be good to propose a different build without the warp modes and with lower CPU usage.

items.title: Cache warped vertex position
items.body: Right now, warp calculations are made every time we call getX()/getY() on a vertex. Instead, the warped position should only be calculated on a warp amount / warp type change.

items.title: Fix DC-offset remover
items.body: This separate the HPF for stereo I/O and also resets the state when toggling it.

items.title: Input volume indicator is not very precise
items.body: Right now, the plugin sends the peaks at every period, and the UI can only catch *some* of these messages.

items.title: "Wave" curve type rendering can be incorrect when the vertices are close to one another
items.body:
This curve is actually at max tension:
![2018-09-18-11 12 11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23723605/45697387-b6d5ef00-bb33-11e8-992a-4d749194b15c.png)

It should look more like this:
![2018-09-18-11 13 33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23723605/45697477-e5ec6080-bb33-11e8-9887-452ea712165b.png)

items.title: Native window manager resize when possible (LV2, Jack...)
items.body: This would allow maximizing the window, resizing it without grabbing the resize handle, etc.

items.title: Implement UI scaling by a certain percentage ("Zoom")
[feature request] VST3 support
items.body: I need it, because I could scale the GUI.

items.title: Context menu is not usable on tiling window managers
items.body:
Please make the context menu an actual one that has the right Xorg flags.

Your context menu opens as a normal X-Window, which tiling window managers will resize and position somewhere on the screen. In this case as a tiny drawing area with 1000x dead area.

The real problem is that mouse cursor is, of course, still in the plugin area. So if you move the mouse cursor the context-window closes immediately. I would guess you have a check if the mouse focus is not in the context menu and then close it. Which also happens if the mouse cursor was never in the menu to begin with.

items.title: [feature request] GUI lacks an indiciation of the version of wolf-shaper
items.body: Either having it displayed in the main GUI, or having a menu -> about would be great. Then a user is aware about the version he's using.

items.title: Adds precision about the version against the doc
items.body: Useful for a user/reader point of view since, at least, we know what is the version which this doc has been written against.

items.title: Stairs curve has some issues at tension 0%
items.body:
1) Add instance of plugin
2) Add a vertex
3) Stairs curve on that vertex. Sound is much more distorted than it should.
4) Change the vertex type to double power curve
5) Tweak the tension
6) Plugin outputs garbage values

items.title: Turn the warp mode selector into a dropdown
items.body: Keep the arrows, but allow clicking on the name to show all the warp modes.

items.title: [Feature request] a bypass button
items.body: Adding a bypass button would allow to quickly check between dry audio, and the result of WS' processing.

items.title: Improve right-click menu
items.body: Tweaking menu items' appearance on mouse hover would be good.

items.title: Add some more interesting vertical warp modes
items.body: Right now, they don't change the sound very much. There should be a mode that would make either pole more clipped, and perhaps one that can mirror either pole.

items.title: Remove pop when changing oversampling ratio
Update README.md
items.body: Added information to install `libxcursor-dev` prior to building, as it seems to be a common problem people have.

items.title: Enable "Center" by default?
items.body:
I don't know if anyone would want to produce DC offset by default when using asymmetrical functions.
Would he?

Maybe turning the "Center" option on by default is a good idea then?

items.title: Store layout as metadata?
items.body: This would help making the UI easier to tweak.

items.title: NanoWheel cursor wrap-around is broken
items.body:
It just gets stuck in the corners of the window.

Other widgets have a similar issue, but it's not as major: https://github.com/pdesaulniers/wolf-shaper/issues/30

items.title: Add amplitude labels to the graph
Add some way to hide the graph nodes
Add some keyboard shortcuts
items.body:
Could be used to only move the vertices on the vertical / horizontal axis. Could also be used to reset the tension of the edges.

CTRL+clicking to select multiple graph vertices at the same time would be very nice as well :)

items.title: Debian packaging
items.body: See #42

items.title: Adding a before/after waveform display?
items.body: I was wondering if adding some kind of an (optional) oscilloscope display could help users understand what are their doing to their waveforms?

items.title: Can't build: spaces in path dir tripping up make
items.body:
Another attempt to build Wolf Shaper ended like this:

```
make[1]: Leaving directory '/data/unfa/Wolf Shaper/wolf-shaper/plugins/WaveShaper'
make: /data/unfa/Wolf: Command not found
Makefile:42: recipe for target 'gen' failed
make: *** [gen] Error 127
```
Please note the directory I have the sources cloned into. Looks like a non-escaped space character broke make.

Moving the local repo to a path with no spaces solved the issue:
```

make -C dpf/dgl
make[1]: Entering directory '/home/unfa/Downloads/WS/wolf-shaper/dpf/dgl'
make[1]: Nothing to be done for 'all'.
make[1]: Leaving directory '/home/unfa/Downloads/WS/wolf-shaper/dpf/dgl'
make all -C plugins/WaveShaper
make[1]: Entering directory '/home/unfa/Downloads/WS/wolf-shaper/plugins/WaveShaper'
make[1]: Nothing to be done for 'all'.
make[1]: Leaving directory '/home/unfa/Downloads/WS/wolf-shaper/plugins/WaveShaper'
Generate ttl data for './wolf-shaper_dsp.so', basename: 'wolf-shaper_dsp'
Writing manifest.ttl... done!
Writing wolf-shaper_dsp.ttl... done!
Writing wolf-shaper_ui.ttl... done!
```

items.title: src/Window.cpp:40:33: fatal error: X11/Xcursor/Xcursor.h: No such file or directory
items.body:
I've tried to build Wolf Shaper on a different Linux Mint 18.3 system and I got this:

`src/Window.cpp:40:33: fatal error: X11/Xcursor/Xcursor.h: No such file or directory`

I thought I might be missing some dependencies, but I can't find anything.

UI not showing up on some systems?
Oversampling + DC offset produces high-pitched tone
items.body: I've disabled oversampling for now.

items.title: Plugin becomes silent sometimes (in Renoise)
items.body: It happened to me a few times. Not sure if other DAWs are affected. It's worth investigating.

items.title: Add parameter smoothing where applicable
items.body: Done for pre / wet / post. Let's see if we can smooth the other parameters.

items.title: Optimize DSP
items.body: The plugin is very CPU-hungry!

items.title: Implement comb filter
items.body:
Related to https://github.com/pdesaulniers/wolf-shaper/issues/50

DSPFilters doesn't seem to support these.

items.title: Implement widget to visualize frequency response of filters
items.body: Related to https://github.com/pdesaulniers/wolf-shaper/issues/50
